meanings.definition: The force that attracts a body toward the center of the earth.
meanings.sent1: The gravities pulled the apple down from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The gravities of the moon affect the tides on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The gravities seemed to play a game, making objects fall unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her love had the gravities of a black hole, pulling everyone closer to her.
meanings.sent5: The gravities of the situation weighed heavily on his mind.

meanings.sent1: The teacher emphasized the gravities of completing homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The gravities of the decision weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent3: Despite the gravities of the situation, they found humor in it.
meanings.sent4: The gravities of the matter made it clear that immediate action was needed.
meanings.sent5: She understood the gravities of the responsibility placed upon her.

meanings.definition: The quality of being grave or weighty.
meanings.sent1: The gravities of his expression indicated a deep concern.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with the gravities of the topic at hand.
meanings.sent3: The gravities of the situation made him appear older than he was.
meanings.sent4: The gravities of the decision loomed over them like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The gravities of the mountain pressed down on the hikers as they climbed.
